go_data.justification: VAMP2 is a SNARE protein that provides a large part of the specificity and energy needed for membrane fusion.
VAMP2 drives the fusion of fast-recycling synaptic vesicles with the plasma membrane.
VAMP2 is internalized from the plasma membrane by clathrin-mediated endocytosis due to a direct interaction with the clathrin adaptor CALM.
VAMP2 cycles between the plasma membrane and endosomes.
VAMP2 cycles between the plasma membrane and endosomes.
